SeattleLandmarks.name: Space Needle
SeattleLandmarks.description: An iconic observation tower in Seattle, offering panoramic views of the surrounding area, including downtown Seattle, Mount Rainier, Puget Sound, and the Olympic and Cascade Mountains.

SeattleLandmarks.name: Pike Place Market
SeattleLandmarks.description: A historic public market overlooking the Elliott Bay waterfront in Seattle. Famous for its fresh produce, seafood, specialty foods, and independent businesses.

SeattleLandmarks.name: Fremont Troll
SeattleLandmarks.description: A large, whimsical public sculpture situated under the north end of the George Washington Memorial Bridge, symbolizing Seattle's creative and quirky culture.

SeattleLandmarks.name: Seattle Art Museum
SeattleLandmarks.description: Located in downtown Seattle, it's known for its significant collections of Asian, African, and Native American art, as well as modern and contemporary art pieces.

SeattleLandmarks.name: Smith Tower
SeattleLandmarks.description: Once the tallest building west of the Mississippi River, this historic skyscraper features an observation deck with stunning views of Seattle.

SeattleLandmarks.name: Kerry Park
SeattleLandmarks.description: Famous for its sweeping views of downtown Seattle, the Space Needle, Elliott Bay, and Mount Rainier on a clear day.

SeattleLandmarks.name: Museum of Flight
SeattleLandmarks.description: One of the largest air and space museums in the world, featuring an extensive collection of aircraft, spacecraft, and related artifacts.

SeattleLandmarks.name: Pioneer Square
SeattleLandmarks.description: Seattle's historic heart with Romanesque Revival architecture, known for its art galleries, boutiques, and bustling nightlife.

SeattleLandmarks.name: Hiram M. Chittenden Locks
SeattleLandmarks.description: Also known as the Ballard Locks, these locks provide a link for boats between the Puget Sound and the Ship Canal, which connects eastward to Lake Union and Lake Washington.

SeattleLandmarks.name: Seattle Waterfront
SeattleLandmarks.description: A vibrant area with attractions such as the Seattle Great Wheel, aquarium, shops, and restaurants, offering stunning views of Elliott Bay.
